policy_name: NIST Cybersecurity Framework - Vulnerability Management Policy
description: Reference security policy aligned with NIST Cybersecurity Framework for vulnerability management

nist_csf_recommendations.description: Maintain an inventory of software platforms and applications, including versions and patch status
nist_csf_recommendations.implementation: Deploy automated asset discovery tools to continuously track software inventory. Document all applications, libraries, and frameworks in use. Integrate with CMDB for centralized visibility.
nist_csf_recommendations.evidence: Maintain software inventory database with automated updates

nist_csf_recommendations.subcategory: Asset vulnerabilities are identified and documented
nist_csf_recommendations.description: Conduct regular vulnerability assessments to identify and document asset weaknesses
nist_csf_recommendations.implementation: Perform weekly automated vulnerability scans using SAST, SCA, DAST, and container security tools. Document findings in vulnerability management system with severity ratings and affected assets.
nist_csf_recommendations.evidence: Weekly vulnerability scan reports with documented findings

nist_csf_recommendations.description: Analyze threats and vulnerabilities to determine likelihood and business impact
nist_csf_recommendations.implementation: Utilize threat intelligence feeds and vulnerability databases (NVD, CVE) to assess risk. Calculate risk scores using CVSS v3.1 metrics combined with asset criticality and threat actor capability.
nist_csf_recommendations.evidence: Risk assessment reports with CVSS scores and business impact analysis

nist_csf_recommendations.description: Develop and implement a comprehensive vulnerability management plan
nist_csf_recommendations.implementation: Establish formal vulnerability management lifecycle including identification, classification, prioritization, remediation, and verification. Define SLAs for remediation based on severity: Critical (24h), High (7d), Medium (30d), Low (90d).
nist_csf_recommendations.evidence: Documented vulnerability management plan with defined processes and SLAs

nist_csf_recommendations.description: Secure remote access mechanisms to prevent exploitation of vulnerabilities
nist_csf_recommendations.implementation: Implement multi-factor authentication for all remote access. Use VPN with strong encryption. Restrict remote access to necessary services only. Monitor and log all remote connections.
nist_csf_recommendations.evidence: MFA deployment status, VPN configuration, remote access logs

nist_csf_recommendations.description: Verify integrity of software and firmware to detect unauthorized changes
nist_csf_recommendations.implementation: Deploy file integrity monitoring (FIM) on critical systems. Use cryptographic hashes to verify software authenticity. Implement secure boot and code signing for applications.
nist_csf_recommendations.evidence: FIM alerts, hash verification logs, code signing certificates

nist_csf_recommendations.description: Conduct regular vulnerability scanning across all assets
nist_csf_recommendations.implementation: Execute automated vulnerability scans weekly using multiple scanning tools (SAST for code, SCA for dependencies, DAST for running applications, Trivy for containers). Integrate scans into CI/CD pipeline for continuous assessment.
nist_csf_recommendations.evidence: Automated scan schedules, scan coverage reports, CI/CD integration logs

nist_csf_recommendations.description: Deploy mechanisms to detect malicious code and unauthorized changes
nist_csf_recommendations.implementation: Use endpoint detection and response (EDR) tools with behavioral analysis. Scan all code commits for secrets and malicious patterns using Semgrep and Gitleaks. Monitor for indicators of compromise (IoCs).
nist_csf_recommendations.evidence: EDR alerts, code scan results, IoC detection logs

nist_csf_recommendations.description: Refine detection capabilities based on lessons learned and threat intelligence
nist_csf_recommendations.implementation: Conduct quarterly reviews of detection rules and signatures. Incorporate threat intelligence to update detection patterns. Tune false positive rates below 5%.
nist_csf_recommendations.evidence: Quarterly detection capability reviews, tuning metrics

nist_csf_recommendations.subcategory: Processes are established for vulnerability disclosure
nist_csf_recommendations.description: Create formal processes for receiving and responding to vulnerability disclosures
nist_csf_recommendations.implementation: Establish security@company.com contact. Publish vulnerability disclosure policy (VDP). Acknowledge reports within 48 hours. Provide updates every 7 days. Follow coordinated disclosure timeline (90 days standard).
nist_csf_recommendations.evidence: Published VDP, disclosure response metrics, researcher acknowledgments

nist_csf_recommendations.description: Implement timely remediation of newly discovered vulnerabilities
nist_csf_recommendations.implementation: Patch critical vulnerabilities within 24 hours, high within 7 days, medium within 30 days, low within 90 days. Apply compensating controls when patches unavailable. Verify remediation effectiveness through re-scanning.
nist_csf_recommendations.evidence: Patching compliance reports, compensating control documentation, verification scans

nist_csf_recommendations.description: Execute recovery procedures following security incidents
nist_csf_recommendations.implementation: Maintain documented recovery runbooks for common vulnerability exploitation scenarios. Test recovery procedures quarterly. Restore from known-good backups. Rebuild compromised systems from hardened baseline images.
nist_csf_recommendations.evidence: Recovery runbooks, quarterly test results, restoration time objectives

iso27001_controls.title: Policies for information security
iso27001_controls.ai_recommendation: Establish comprehensive information security policies that include vulnerability management requirements, roles and responsibilities, and compliance obligations

iso27001_controls.title: Management of technical vulnerabilities
iso27001_controls.ai_recommendation: Implement systematic processes to identify, evaluate, and remediate technical vulnerabilities in systems and software. Maintain vulnerability inventory and track remediation progress.

remediation_priorities.reasoning: Critical vulnerabilities with active exploits pose immediate risk to confidentiality, integrity, and availability of systems

remediation_priorities.action: Address high-severity vulnerabilities within one week
remediation_priorities.reasoning: High-severity vulnerabilities could be exploited to gain unauthorized access or cause significant business impact
Medium-severity vulnerabilities require remediation but may have compensating controls or lower exploitability
Low-severity vulnerabilities have minimal immediate impact but should be remediated as part of regular maintenance
